Contributor.Organization: Sloan Kettering Institute for Cancer Research

Platform.Title: M. tuberculosis oligo
Platform.Description: This M. tuberculosis whole genome microarray was constructed from the Operon Tuberculosis whole genome oligo set, version 1.0 (http://www.operon.com/arrays/oligosets_tb.php). The complete array was spotted in duplicate on each slide using a Biorobotics Microgrid II with oligonucleotides resuspended at 20 micromolar in 50%DMSO on Corning UltraGaps Coated slides. Arrays were crosslinked immediately after printing in a Stratalinker with 300mJ.

Sample.Title: WTCy3/Rv2869c Cy5 no Tween #1
Sample.Description:
o All RNA was from the indicated strain of M. tuberculosis (either wild type M. tuberculosis Erdman or the Mtb Rv2869c null mutant •RNA was isolated from logarithmic phase cultures at OD600 .3. For (+Tween) conditions, the media was Middlebrook 7H9 with 10% OADC supplement, .5% glycerol, and .05% Tween 80. For (-Tween) conditions, bacilli were transferred to identical media without Tween 80 and harvested for RNA preparation 18hours later.
Protocol for preparing the hybridization extract:
15ml of liquid culture described above were collected by centrifugation at 3000g, and cell pellets frozen on dry ice. Frozen pellets were resuspended in 1ml of Trizol reagent (Invitrogen) and lysed by mechanical disruption using .7mm Zirconia beads for 3 x 1min in a Mini bead beater 8 (Biospec products) at maximum speed. The remainder of the procedure was according to the Trizol manufacturers instructions with the addition of the optional high salt precipitation step. RNA was subsequently cleaned using Qiagen RNAeasy columns according ot the manufacturers RNA cleanup protocol.
Labeling protocol(s). 5-7.5micrograms of total RNA was labeled using the Fairplay microrray labeling kit (Stratagene) with substitution of Random Hexamer primers. Aminoallyl labeled CDNA was coupled to Cy3/Cy5 using Post labeling reactive dye packs (Amersham). Excess dye was removed using Qiaquick nucleotide removal columns according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Column.Name: Cy5 Mean
Column.Description: Cy5 fluorescence intensity for feature Wild type cells in this sample

Column.Name: Cy3 Mean
Column.Description: Cy3 fluorescence intensity for feature Rv2869c mutant cells in this sample

Series.Title: Mtb Rv2869c mutant/WT +/- detergent
Series.Summary: The purpose of this experiment is to examine gene expression controlled by Rv2869c in the presence or absence of detergent (Tween 80) in the culture medium. Keywords: parallel sample
Series.Overall-Design: Wild type Mtb and the Rv2869c mutant were grown either with or without the detergent Tween 80 in the culture medium. Each hybridization is wild type versus mutant with three biologic replicates (+Tw) or Two biologic replicates (-Tw). Each array contains two spots for each gene. Each condition (+/-Tw) contains one dye swap (WTCy3).
